Today the House Committee on Agriculture held a hearing to Review the State of #BlackFarmers Â Black farmers sold $1.4 billion of products in 2017, accounting for only 0.4% of total US ag sales.

#Blackfarmers in the US have never had the same access to capital, research, or resources made available to their counterparts. Itâ€™s time to start righting those wrongs and leveling the playing field.

By and large, #Blackfarmers in the US have never been able to reach their full potential because of decades of discrimination at USDA that reduced their access to loans and other resources from FSA and County Extension services.

As members of rural communities, #BlackFarmers know the need for and interest in better access to healthy food.  It is about time these farmers are put on the same footing as other farmers and not held back by laws and rules that favor non-minority farmers.
